page.title: 01BRISTOL,DOWNS AND SUBURBS
page.content: Our area is mainly residential. The bulk of the houses were built either at the turn of the century or between the wars.Throughout the area houses have gone from single family units to flats and bedsits and back again and the process still flows. There are contrasts within the over all pattern.{Stoke Bishop}in the north west has large distinguished detached houses and University halls of residence around the open area of the Downs. {St.Pauls}in the south east has small terraces and new council flats and is slowly recovering from city centre planning blight and neglect. The two main shopping streets run north/south.{Gloucester Road}in the east serves{Horfield,Ashley Down, {Bishopston}and{St.Andrews}while{White- {ladies Road}serves{Clifton,Cotham}and{ {Redland.Westbury Park}has its own.
